Rules.InvariantScript:
"Welcome, "& Parent.compUser &"!
Today is: " & Concatenate(Text( Today(), "dddd" ),", ",Text( Today(), "dd/mm/yy" )) & ""

"data:image/svg+xml;utf8, "&EncodeUrl("

<svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' xmlns:xlink='http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink' style='margin: auto; background: rgb(255, 255, 255,0); display: block; shape-rendering: auto;' width='200px' height='200px' viewBox='0 0 100 100' preserveAspectRatio='xMidYMid'>
<g transform='rotate(0 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.9166666666666666s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(30 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.8333333333333334s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(60 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.75s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(90 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.6666666666666666s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(120 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.5833333333333334s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(150 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.5s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(180 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.4166666666666667s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(210 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.3333333333333333s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(240 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.25s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(270 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.16666666666666666s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(300 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='-0.08333333333333333s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g><g transform='rotate(330 50 50)'>
  <rect x='47' y='24' rx='3' ry='6' width='6' height='12' fill='#999898'>
    <animate attributeName='opacity' values='1;0' keyTimes='0;1' dur='1s' begin='0s' repeatCount='indefinite'></animate>
  </rect>
</g>
</svg>
")

//Refreshing data as the most recent data is needed all the time. Function concurrent used for shorterning operation time on refreshing the data.
Concurrent(
    Refresh('SharePoint List (dbReportedData)'),
    Refresh('SharePoint List (dbUserTemplate)'),
    Refresh('SharePoint List (dictAccounts)')
);
//Storing user's info - more information than with User() function 
Set(
    gblUser,
    Office365Users.MyProfileV2()
);
/*
AddColumns used to add local columns used in the app, but not needed in SP. 
RenameColumns - this is for presentation only. Sometimes when we deal with the same column names in two different SharePoint lists or collections, and we need to compare them, it is a good practice to rename desired column templorary to make sure we reference the right one (from correct SharePoint list). We go back to previous name after the whole operation is done. Similar effect can be achived with "With()" function.
Best example: icoSaveTemplate
DropColumns/ShowColumns - we get rid of colums not needed in the app to limit numer of data and improve readability (when developing the app). For colAccounts usually I'd also use ShowColumns, but for presentation purposes this time is used DropColumns.
*/
//This collection is used to store user's template
ClearCollect(
    colUserTemplateNew,
    RenameColumns(
        AddColumns(
            Filter(
                RenameColumns(
                    ShowColumns(
                        'SharePoint List (dbUserTemplate)',
                        "Account",
                        "BusinessUnit",
                        "Currency",
                        "ID",
                        "SystemERP",
                        "User"
                    ),
                    "User",
                    "tempUser"
                ),
                tempUser.Email = User().Email
            ),
            "locStatus",
            "Saved",
            "locGUID",
            GUID()
        ),
        "tempUser",
        "User"
    )
);
ClearCollect(
    colAccounts,
    DropColumns(
        'SharePoint List (dictAccounts)',
        "ComplianceAssetId",
        "{FilenameWithExtension}",
        "{FullPath}",
        "{Identifier}",
        "{IsFolder}",
        "{Link}",
        "{ModerationComment}",
        "{ModerationStatus}",
        "{Name}",
        "{Path}",
        "{Thumbnail}",
        "{TriggerWindowEndToken}",
        "{TriggerWindowStartToken}",
        "{VersionNumber}",
        "Author",
        "Editor",
        "Title",
        "Created",
        "Modified"
    )
);
//Collect data based on account number to collect as much data as possible (since limit 2k per one loop)
Clear(colReportedData);
ForAll(
    Distinct(
        colAccounts,
        Account
    ),
    With(
        {ThisAccount: ThisRecord.Result},
        Collect(
            colReportedData,
            Filter(
                ShowColumns(
                    'SharePoint List (dbReportedData)',
                    "Account",
                    "AmountIn",
                    "AmountOut",
                    "Approver",
                    "BusinessUnit",
                    "Currency",
                    "ID",
                    "IsApproved",
                    "ItemsIn",
                    "ItemsOut",
                    "StatementDate",
                    "SystemERP",
                    "User",
                    "ZeroBalanceAmount"
                ),
                Account = ThisAccount 
            )
        )
    )
);
Navigate(
    'Home Page',
    ScreenTransition.Fade
)
